item.title: Lets make a Sankey!
item.description: In many ways1, I am a simple man. If I see an opportunity to make a Sankey, I get my Sankey on. Here’s the plan2. The Plan (explain plan here)3 Ok, now to jump in and start coding! library(ggplot2) #priorities library(tidyverse) library(ggthemes) library(instaR) #devtools::install_github("pablobarbera/instaR/instaR") … okay after horsing around for a bit trying to get an access token for Instagram’s API and being very sketchily asked to pretend to be a “business”, upload a pic of my “app icon” and makeup something official sounding to put as my “privacy policy url”

item.title: About
item.description: Websters dictionary defines “about” as: about, adverb: reasonably close to which I thought1 would be more relevant tbh. I’m not so sure about this whole new trend to “do a blog” about “things” I am “interested” in 2 to “try to impress” the imagined beings who may click on something that commands their computer to render this3. It seems presumptuious and rude. In conclusion, this is a place where patterns are stored on a server due to the vibrations of my brain 4.

item.title: About
item.description: Websters dictionary defines “about” as: about, adverb: reasonably close to which I thought1 would be more helpful in this context tbh. I'm not so sure about this whole new trend to do a blog about topics I am interested in 2 to try to impress a handful of imagined beings who may click on something that commands their screen to render this3. The whole idea just seems presumptuous and rude.

item.title: There may be a blog post here someday
item.description: But not today. seriously, its not. I’m just trying to plot something to see if it works. like this 1 Figure 1: hmmm.

item.title: Covid-19 in Skagit Valley, Wa
item.description: Total daily counts of covid-19 cases, hospitalizations and deaths reported by Skagit Public Health. Cases include total confirmed and presumptive positives, which means that a private lab reported a positive test. Hospitalized are people with positive tests who were hospitalized at any point during their illness. The first case in Skagit Valley was reported on March 10, 2020.
